an4.197:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an4.197:4.2: Then Queen Mallikā went up to the Buddha,
an4.197:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
an4.197:5.1: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why in this life some females are ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking;
an4.197:5.2: and poor, with few assets and possessions; and insignificant?
an4.197:6.1: And why are some females ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking;
an4.197:6.2: but rich, affluent, wealthy, and eminent?
an4.197:7.1: And why are some females attractive, good-looking, impressive, perfect flowers of beauty;
an4.197:7.2: but poor, with few assets and possessions; and insignificant?
an4.197:8.1: And why are some females attractive, good-looking, impressive, perfect flowers of beauty; and rich, affluent, wealthy, and eminent?”
an4.197:9.1: “Take a female who gets angry and is often annoyed.
an4.197:9.2: Even when criticized a little bit she loses her temper, becoming irritated, hostile, and hard-hearted, and displaying irritation, hate, and bitterness.
an4.197:9.3: She doesn’t give to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, perfumes, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
an4.197:9.5: envying, resenting, and begrudging the possessions, honor, respect, reverence, homage, and worship given to others.
an4.197:9.6: If she comes back to this realm after passing away, wherever she is reborn she’s ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking;
an4.197:9.7: and poor, with few assets and possessions; and insignificant.
an4.197:10.1: Take another female who gets angry and is often annoyed. …
an4.197:10.3: But she does give to ascetics or brahmins …
an4.197:10.6: If she comes back to this realm after passing away, wherever she is reborn she’s ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking;
an4.197:10.7: but rich, affluent, wealthy, and eminent.
an4.197:11.1: Take another female who doesn’t get angry and is not often annoyed.
an4.197:11.2: Even when criticized a lot, she doesn’t lose her temper, become irritated, hostile, and hard-hearted, or display irritation, hate, and bitterness.
an4.197:11.3: She doesn’t give to ascetics or brahmins …
an4.197:11.6: If she comes back to this realm after passing away, wherever she is reborn she’s attractive, good-looking, impressive, a perfect flower of beauty;
an4.197:11.7: but poor, with few assets and possessions; and insignificant.
an4.197:12.1: Take another female who gets angry and is often annoyed. …
an4.197:12.2: Take another female who doesn’t get angry and is not often annoyed.
an4.197:12.3: She gives to ascetics and brahmins …
an4.197:12.6: If she comes back to this realm after passing away, wherever she is reborn she’s attractive, good-looking, impressive, a perfect flower of beauty;
an4.197:12.7: and rich, affluent, wealthy, and eminent.
an4.197:13.1: This is why are some females are ugly …
an4.197:14.1: When this was said, Queen Mallikā said to the Buddha:
an4.197:14.2: “Sir, in another life I must have got angry and often annoyed. Even when criticized a little bit I must have lost my temper, becoming irritated, hostile, and hard-hearted, and displaying irritation, hate, and bitterness. For now I am ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking.
an4.197:15.1: In another life I must have given to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, perfumes, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting. For now I am rich, affluent, and wealthy.
an4.197:16.1: In another life, I must not have been jealous, envying, resenting, and begrudging the possessions, honor, respect, reverence, homage, and worship given to others. For now I am eminent.
an4.197:16.2: In this royal court I command maidens of the aristocrats, brahmins, and householders.
an4.197:16.3: So, sir, from this day forth I will not get angry or be often annoyed. Even when criticized a lot I won’t lose my temper, become irritated, hostile, and hard-hearted, or display irritation, hate, and bitterness.
an4.197:16.4: I will give to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, perfumes, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
an4.197:16.5: I will not be jealous, envying, resenting, and begrudging the possessions, honor, respect, reverence, homage, and worship given to others.
an4.197:16.6: “Excellent, sir! … From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
